channel.title: Alexander Calder on Artangled
channel.description: Recent content in Alexander Calder on Artangled

item.title: Calder/Miro - Clair de lune | Nahmad Projects
item.description: Alexander Calder and Joan Miró were good friends, with a lot in common. The same goes for the work, too, and this dreamy little exhibition proves it. Working in Paris, both took the most crowd-pleasing bits of the Surrealist movement they were surrounded with, and expressed it in antic, zany, colourful form. Calder made mobiles, Miró paintings. They’re both still really popular: the last couple of years having brought major retrospectives for Calder at the Whitney, and Miró at the Grand Palais.
